description: The uptime dashboard displays data about the hosts, high availability vms and all vms uptime and downtime.

panels.content: ###### This dashboard displays uptime and downtime data for the hosts, high availability virtual machines and all virtual machines in the selected cluster.

panels.description: The average unplanned downtime per cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR7A - This query returns the
-- average planned and unplanned downtime,
-- average uptime and total time per cluster.

-- unplanned downtime
SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    delete_date,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) / AVG ( total ) AS unplanned_downtime
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            hourly_daily.host_id,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 3
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS uptime_mins,
            SUM 
                ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status ) AS total
        FROM
            (
                SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
            ) AS hourly_daily
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                        hourly_daily.host_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id =
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
                        GROUP BY a.cluster_id
                    )
            -- Here we get the latest hosts configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts AS b
                        GROUP BY b.host_id
                    )
            -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            hourly_daily.host_id
    ) AS sub_query
GROUP BY cluster_id, name, delete_date
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST ( AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS float ) / CAST ( AVG ( total ) AS float ) DESC

panels.title: Unplanned Downtime (BR7A)

panels.description: The average planned downtime per cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR7A - This query returns the
-- average planned and unplanned downtime,
-- average uptime and total time per cluster.

-- planned downtime
SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    delete_date,
    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) / AVG ( total ) AS planned_downtime
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            hourly_daily.host_id,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 2
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS uptime_mins,
            SUM 
                ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status ) AS total
        FROM
            (
                SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
            ) AS hourly_daily
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                        hourly_daily.host_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id =
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
                        GROUP BY a.cluster_id
                    )
            -- Here we get the latest hosts configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts AS b
                        GROUP BY b.host_id
                    )
            -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            hourly_daily.host_id
    ) AS sub_query
GROUP BY cluster_id, name, delete_date
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST ( AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS float ) / CAST ( AVG ( total ) AS float ) DESC

panels.title: Planned Downtime (BR7A)

panels.description: The average planned and unplanned downtime, average uptime and total time per cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR7A - This query returns the
-- average planned and unplanned downtime,
-- average uptime and total time per cluster.

SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    delete_date,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS uptime_mins,
    AVG ( total ) AS total
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            hourly_daily.host_id,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 2
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 3
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS uptime_mins,
            SUM ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status ) AS total
        FROM
            (
                SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
            ) AS hourly_daily
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                        hourly_daily.host_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id =
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
                        GROUP BY a.cluster_id
                    )
            -- Here we get the latest hosts configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts AS b
                        GROUP BY b.host_id
                    )
            -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            hourly_daily.host_id
    ) AS sub_query
GROUP BY cluster_id, name, delete_date
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST ( AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS float ) / CAST ( AVG ( total ) AS float ) DESC

panels.title: Downtime by Cluster (BR7A)

panels.description: The average planned and unplanned downtime, and total time for each host per cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR7A - This query returns the
-- average planned and unplanned downtime,
-- average uptime and total time per cluster.

SELECT
    name AS cluster_name,
    host_name,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( total ) AS total
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_name,
            hourly_daily.host_id,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 2
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 3
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS uptime_mins,
            SUM ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status ) AS total
        FROM
            (
                SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
            ) AS hourly_daily
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                        hourly_daily.host_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id =
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
                        GROUP BY a.cluster_id
                    )
            -- Here we get the latest hosts configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts AS b
                        GROUP BY b.host_id
                    )
            -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_name,
            hourly_daily.host_id
    ) AS sub_query
GROUP BY cluster_id, name, delete_date, host_name
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST ( AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS float ) / CAST ( AVG ( total ) AS float ) DESC

panels.title: Downtime by Host (BR7A)

panels.description: The average unplanned downtime per cluster and virtual machine server.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR14A - This query returns the
-- average unplanned downtime, uptime
-- and total time per cluster and vm server.

-- unplanned downtime
SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) / AVG ( total ) AS unplanned_downtime
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status = 3
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS uptime_mins,
            SUM ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status ) AS total
        FROM
            (
                SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
            ) AS hourly_daily
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                        hourly_daily.vm_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id =
                        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
            -- Here we get only vms of type "server"
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_type = 1
            -- Here we get only vms that are marked as "high availability"
            AND high_availability = TRUE
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
                        GROUP BY a.cluster_id
                    )
            -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms AS b
                        GROUP BY b.vm_id
                    )
            -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id
    ) AS sub_query
GROUP BY cluster_id, name, delete_date
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST ( AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS float ) / CAST ( AVG ( total ) AS float ) DESC

panels.title: Unplanned Downtime (BR14A)

panels.description: The average planned downtime per cluster and virtual machine server.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR14A - This query returns the
-- average unplanned downtime, uptime
-- and total time per cluster and vm server.

-- planned downtime
SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) / AVG ( total ) AS planned_downtime
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status IN ( 2, 0 )
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS uptime_mins,
            SUM ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status ) AS total
        FROM
            (
                SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
            ) AS hourly_daily
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                        hourly_daily.vm_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id =
                        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
            -- Here we get only vms of type "server"
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_type = 1
            -- Here we get only vms that are marked as "high availability"
            AND high_availability = TRUE
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
                        GROUP BY a.cluster_id
                    )
            -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms AS b
                        GROUP BY b.vm_id
                    )
            -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id
    ) AS sub_query
GROUP BY cluster_id, name, delete_date
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST ( AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS float ) / CAST ( AVG ( total ) AS float ) DESC

panels.title: Planned Downtime (BR14A)

panels.description: The average planned and unplanned downtime, and total time per cluster and virtual machine server.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR14A - This query returns the
-- average unplanned downtime, uptime
-- and total time per cluster and vm server.

SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    delete_date,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) AS planned_downtime_mins,

        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,

            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
            SUM 
                (

                        WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status = 3
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )

            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status IN ( 2, 0 )
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS uptime_mins,
            SUM ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status ) AS total
        FROM
            (
                SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
            ) AS hourly_daily
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                        hourly_daily.vm_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id =
                        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
            -- Here we get only vms of type "server"
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_type = 1
            -- Here we get only vms that are marked as "high availability"
            AND high_availability = TRUE
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
                        GROUP BY a.cluster_id
                    )
            -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms AS b
                        GROUP BY b.vm_id
                    )
            -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id
    ) AS sub_query
GROUP BY cluster_id, name, delete_date
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST ( AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS float ) / CAST ( AVG ( total ) AS float ) DESC

panels.title: Downtime by Cluster (BR14A)

panels.description: The average planned and unplanned downtime, and total time for each high availability virtual machine per cluster and virtual machine server.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR14A - This query returns the
-- average unplanned downtime, uptime
-- and total time per cluster and vm server.

SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    vm_name,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( total ) AS total
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status = 3
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status IN ( 2, 0 )
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS uptime_mins,
            SUM ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status ) AS total
        FROM
            (
                SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
            ) AS hourly_daily
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                        hourly_daily.vm_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id =
                        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
            -- Here we get only vms of type "server"
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_type = 1
            -- Here we get only vms that are marked as "high availability"
            AND high_availability = TRUE
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
                        GROUP BY a.cluster_id
                    )
            -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms AS b
                        GROUP BY b.vm_id
                    )
            -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id
    ) AS sub_query
GROUP BY cluster_id, name, delete_date, vm_name 
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST ( AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS float ) / CAST ( AVG ( total ) AS float ) DESC

panels.title: Downtime by Virtual Machine (BR14A)

panels.description: The average unplanned downtime per cluster and virtual machine server.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR14A - This query returns the
-- average unplanned downtime, uptime
-- and total time per cluster and vm server.

-- unplanned downtime
SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    delete_date,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) / AVG ( total ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_status = 3
                            THEN COALESCE ( v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_status = 1
                            THEN COALESCE ( v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS uptime_mins,
            SUM ( v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status ) AS total
        FROM 
            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id =
                        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
                        GROUP BY a.cluster_id
                    )
            -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms AS b
                        GROUP BY b.vm_id
                    )
            -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id
    ) AS sub_query
GROUP BY cluster_id, name, delete_date
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST ( AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS float ) / CAST ( AVG ( total ) AS float ) DESC

panels.title: Unplanned Downtime (BR14A)

panels.description: The average planned downtime per cluster and virtual machine server.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR14A - This query returns the
-- average unplanned downtime, uptime
-- and total time per cluster and vm server.

-- planned downtime
SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    delete_date,
    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) / AVG ( total )  AS planned_downtime_mins
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_status IN ( 2, 0 )
                            THEN COALESCE ( v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_status = 1
                            THEN COALESCE ( v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS uptime_mins,
            SUM ( v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status ) AS total
        FROM 
            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id =
                        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
                        GROUP BY a.cluster_id
                    )
            -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms AS b
                        GROUP BY b.vm_id
                    )
            -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id
    ) AS sub_query
GROUP BY cluster_id, name, delete_date
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST ( AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS float ) / CAST ( AVG ( total ) AS float ) DESC

panels.title: Planned Downtime  (BR14A)

panels.description: The average planned and unplanned downtime, and total time per cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR14A - This query returns the
-- average unplanned downtime, uptime
-- and total time per cluster.

SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    delete_date,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( total ) AS total
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status = 3
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status IN ( 2, 0 )
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS uptime_mins,
            SUM ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status ) AS total
        FROM
            (
                SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
            ) AS hourly_daily
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                        hourly_daily.vm_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id =
                        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
            -- Here we get only vms of type "server"
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_type = 1
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
                        GROUP BY a.cluster_id
                    )
            -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms AS b
                        GROUP BY b.vm_id
                    )
            -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id
    ) AS sub_query
GROUP BY cluster_id, name, delete_date
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST ( AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS float ) / CAST ( AVG ( total ) AS float ) DESC

panels.title: Downtime by Cluster (BR14A)

panels.description: The average planned and unplanned downtime, and total time for each virtual machine per cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR14A - This query returns the
-- average unplanned downtime, uptime
-- and total time per cluster and vm server.

SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    vm_name,
    CAST (high_availability AS varchar) AS high_availability,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( total ) AS total
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_name,
            high_availability,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status = 3
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status IN ( 2, 0 )
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS uptime_mins,
            SUM ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status ) AS total
        FROM
            (
                SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
            ) AS hourly_daily
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                        hourly_daily.vm_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id =
                        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
            -- Here we get only vms of type "server"
         -- AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_type = 1
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
                        GROUP BY a.cluster_id
                    )
            -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms AS b
                        GROUP BY b.vm_id
                    )
            -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_name,
            high_availability
    ) AS sub_query
GROUP BY cluster_id, name, delete_date, vm_name, high_availability
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST ( AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS float ) / CAST ( AVG ( total ) AS float ) DESC

panels.title: Downtime by Virtual Machine (BR14A)

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_name AS __text , datacenter_id AS __value FROM v4_3_latest_configuration_datacenters
